rules.natural: If the driver has authorization for transport, then that authorization is valid.
Whenever manager1 approves the shipment, and provided that the driver's schedule for shift1 is approved, and under the condition that route1 is assigned to truck1, then truck1 dispatches the goods.
Either manager1 approves the shipment or supervisor1 approves the shipment.
In the event that supervisor1 approves the shipment, director1 also approves the shipment.
Provided that director1 approves the shipment, and if the driver's schedule for shift1 is approved, and under the condition that route1 is assigned to truck1, then truck1 dispatches the goods.
Either a security alert is active at the facility or, if a security breach is detected, the facility is not under system lockdown.
Whenever guard patrol is active at the facility, the security protocol is enabled.
Either guard patrol is active at the facility or surveillance is active at the facility.
If surveillance is active at the facility, then a security alert is not active.
Provided that maintenance is required for truck1, truck1 is ready as a vehicle.
If a mechanic is available at the garage, then truck1 is not ready.
Whenever a technician is available at the garage, truck1 is not ready.
Under the condition that the day shift is active at the garage, a mechanic is available.
Either the day shift is active at the garage or the night shift is active.
If the night shift is active at the garage, then a technician is available.
Provided that the daily check for truck1 is complete, truck1 has passed inspection.
If the weekly check for truck1 is complete, then whenever truck1 is operational, the goods will be delivered on time.
Either the warehouse has the goods available or, given that the driver's authorization for transport is valid, the goods are delivered on time.
If there is a GPS malfunction in the navigation system, location tracking is not active.
Provided that the satellite signal is strong, and if there is a GPS malfunction, then location tracking is active.
Either the satellite signal is strong for the navigation system or the cellular signal is strong.
If the cellular signal is strong for the navigation system, then the Wi-Fi signal is strong.
Under the condition that the Wi-Fi signal is strong, and if a GPS malfunction happens, location tracking is active.
Should route1 be assigned to truck1, then truck1 has sufficient fuel.
Should it not be true that either an emergency override occurs or the goods are delivered on time, then a manual override does not happen.
If neither the daily check is complete nor the weekly check is complete for truck1, then the navigation has a GPS malfunction.
In the event that having sufficient fuel does not lead to truck1 dispatching the goods, then refueling is scheduled for truck1.
Provided that sufficient fuel does not result in truck1 dispatching the goods, refueling is not scheduled.
If the scarcity of goods does not imply their unavailability at the warehouse, then there is an overflow of goods.
Whenever truck1's operational status does not guarantee on-time delivery, route1 is assigned to truck1.
If truck1 being operational does not lead to on-time delivery, then truck1 does not dispatch the goods.
In the case where the absence of either an emergency override or on-time delivery does not necessitate a manual override, the facility enters system lockdown.
Provided that the failure of truck1's operational status to ensure on-time delivery does not result in dispatching the goods, maintenance is required for truck1.

The goods are scarce at the warehouse.
The driver's schedule for shift1 is approved.
It is not the case that the system has an emergency override.
The security protocol is not enabled at the facility.
There is no overflow of goods at the warehouse.

target.natural: The goods will be delivered on time to the destination.

Should the navigation system have a GPS malfunction, then location tracking is active.
The navigation system does not have a GPS malfunction.
Either the daily check for truck1 is complete or the weekly check is complete.
Either truck1 has passed inspection or, if truck1 is operational, the goods are delivered on time.
Whenever truck1 is operational, the goods are delivered on time.
The goods will be delivered on time to the destination.
Provided that truck1 has sufficient fuel, it dispatches the goods.
In the event that route1 is assigned to truck1, truck1 dispatches the goods.

(A1 → A2).natural: If the driver has authorization for transport, then that authorization is valid.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that the driver has authorization for transport, the goods will be delivered on time to the destination.

(A10 → (A9 → (A8 → A7))).natural: Whenever manager1 approves the shipment, and provided that the driver's schedule for shift1 is approved, and under the condition that route1 is assigned to truck1, then truck1 dispatches the goods.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either manager1 approves the shipment or supervisor1 approves the shipment.

(A11 → (A9 → (A8 → A7))).natural: If supervisor1 approves the shipment, then given that the driver's schedule for shift1 is approved, and whenever route1 is assigned to truck1, it follows that truck1 dispatches the goods.

(A11 → A12).natural: In the event that supervisor1 approves the shipment, director1 also approves the shipment.

(A12 → (A9 → (A8 → A7))).natural: Provided that director1 approves the shipment, and if the driver's schedule for shift1 is approved, and under the condition that route1 is assigned to truck1, then truck1 dispatches the goods.

(A13 ∨ G).natural: Either the system has an emergency override or the goods are delivered on time to the destination.

(A16 → ¬A15).natural: Should a security breach be detected at the facility, then the facility is not under system lockdown.

(A17 ∨ (A16 → ¬A15)).natural: Either a security alert is active at the facility or, if a security breach is detected, the facility is not under system lockdown.

(A18 ∨ ¬A17).natural: Either the security protocol is enabled at the facility, or it is not the case that a security alert is active.

(A19 → A18).natural: Whenever guard patrol is active at the facility, the security protocol is enabled.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Either guard patrol is active at the facility or surveillance is active at the facility.

(A2 → G).natural: Given that the driver's authorization for transport is valid, the goods will be delivered on time to the destination.

(A20 → ¬A17).natural: If surveillance is active at the facility, then a security alert is not active.

(A21 → A22).natural: Provided that maintenance is required for truck1, truck1 is ready as a vehicle.

(A23 → ¬A22).natural: If a mechanic is available at the garage, then truck1 is not ready.

(A23 ∨ A24).natural: Either a mechanic is available at the garage or a technician is available at the garage.

(A24 → ¬A22).natural: Whenever a technician is available at the garage, truck1 is not ready.

(A25 → A23).natural: Under the condition that the day shift is active at the garage, a mechanic is available.

(A25 ∨ A26).natural: Either the day shift is active at the garage or the night shift is active.

(A26 → A24).natural: If the night shift is active at the garage, then a technician is available.

(A27 ∨ (A6 → G)).natural: Either truck1 has passed inspection or, if truck1 is operational, the goods are delivered on time.

(A28 → A27).natural: Provided that the daily check for truck1 is complete, truck1 has passed inspection.

(A28 ∨ A29).natural: Either the daily check for truck1 is complete or the weekly check is complete.

(A29 → (A6 → G)).natural: If the weekly check for truck1 is complete, then whenever truck1 is operational, the goods will be delivered on time.

(A3 ∨ (A2 → G)).natural: Either the warehouse has the goods available or, given that the driver's authorization for transport is valid, the goods are delivered on time.

(A30 → A31).natural: Should the navigation system have a GPS malfunction, then location tracking is active.

(A30 → ¬A31).natural: If there is a GPS malfunction in the navigation system, location tracking is not active.

(A32 → (A30 → A31)).natural: Provided that the satellite signal is strong, and if there is a GPS malfunction, then location tracking is active.

(A32 ∨ A33).natural: Either the satellite signal is strong for the navigation system or the cellular signal is strong.

(A33 → (A30 → A31)).natural: Whenever the cellular signal is strong, and given a GPS malfunction occurs, location tracking is active.

(A33 → A34).natural: If the cellular signal is strong for the navigation system, then the Wi-Fi signal is strong.

(A34 → (A30 → A31)).natural: Under the condition that the Wi-Fi signal is strong, and if a GPS malfunction happens, location tracking is active.

(A35 → A7).natural: Provided that truck1 has sufficient fuel, it dispatches the goods.

(A4 → ¬A3).natural: If the goods are scarce at the warehouse, then the goods are not available.

(A6 → G).natural: Whenever truck1 is operational, the goods are delivered on time.

(A8 → A35).natural: Should route1 be assigned to truck1, then truck1 has sufficient fuel.

(A8 → A7).natural: In the event that route1 is assigned to truck1, truck1 dispatches the goods.

(A9 → (A8 → A7)).natural: Provided that the driver's schedule for shift1 is approved, and if route1 is assigned to truck1, then truck1 dispatches the goods.

(¬(A13 ∨ G) → A14).natural: If it is not the case that either an emergency override is active or the goods are delivered on time, then a manual override is activated for the system.

(¬(A13 ∨ G) → ¬A14).natural: Should it not be true that either an emergency override occurs or the goods are delivered on time, then a manual override does not happen.

(¬(A28 ∨ A29) → A30).natural: If neither the daily check is complete nor the weekly check is complete for truck1, then the navigation has a GPS malfunction.

(¬(A35 → A7) → A36).natural: In the event that having sufficient fuel does not lead to truck1 dispatching the goods, then refueling is scheduled for truck1.

(¬(A35 → A7) → ¬A36).natural: Provided that sufficient fuel does not result in truck1 dispatching the goods, refueling is not scheduled.

(¬(A4 → ¬A3) → A5).natural: If the scarcity of goods does not imply their unavailability at the warehouse, then there is an overflow of goods.

(¬(A6 → G) → A7).natural: Should truck1 being operational not entail on-time delivery of goods, then truck1 dispatches the goods.

(¬(A6 → G) → A8).natural: Whenever truck1's operational status does not guarantee on-time delivery, route1 is assigned to truck1.

(¬(A6 → G) → ¬A7).natural: If truck1 being operational does not lead to on-time delivery, then truck1 does not dispatch the goods.

(¬(¬(A13 ∨ G) → A14) → A15).natural: In the case where the absence of either an emergency override or on-time delivery does not necessitate a manual override, the facility enters system lockdown.

(¬(¬(A6 → G) → A7) → A21).natural: Provided that the failure of truck1's operational status to ensure on-time delivery does not result in dispatching the goods, maintenance is required for truck1.

A16.natural: A security breach has been detected at the facility.

G.natural: The goods will be delivered on time to the destination.

¬A18.natural: The security protocol is not enabled at the facility.

¬A21.natural: Maintenance is not required for truck1.

¬A22.natural: Truck1 is not ready as a vehicle.

¬A3.natural: The warehouse does not have the goods available.
